DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cerebrospinal Fluid Diagnostic Procedure Closing Pressure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord._Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder._The measured pressure in the spinal canal after cerebrospinal fluid collection during lumbar puncture._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredName: Closing Pressure at Lumbar Puncture Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: The measured pressure in the spinal canal after cerebrospinal fluid collection during lumbar puncture. :Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The measured pressure in the spinal canal after cerebrospinal fluid collection during lumbar puncture.
Executed and carried through to completion.
